About Us See Micro-Restaurants The Food Factory Where Flavor Meets Community- Oviedo's Culinary Gem Dive into a world where community and flavor collide, creating unforgettable experiences. About Us See Micro-Restaurants MICRO-RESTAURANTS The Food Factory Experience The Food Factory is more than a dining destination; it's a place where culinary delights meet community spirit. Enjoy our covered outdoor and open-air courtyard spaces, perfect for socializing, dining, and creating memories. BAR Oviedo Park Pub Oviedo Park Pub is your neighborhood bar, where you can comfortably sit back and relax in leather seats, sipping on specialty cocktails or a bourbon from our growing collection. Crack open a beer and watch the NFL ticket or UCF games on our 15 tv’s and 140-inch projector screen. Can’t decide on what to eat? Dine inside with any food option located within the Food Factory plaza. Keep an eye out for live music and adult-friendly events! LEARN MORE PIZZA Buttercrust Pizza Buttercrust Pizza is not just about pizza; it’s about a pizza experience unlike any other. With a variety of crusts and an endless array of toppings, we cater to all tastes and preferences. Join us for a meal where quality and flavor are always top priorities. learn more AMERICAN COMFORT The Local Hen The Local Hen offers a comforting taste of Southern hospitality right in the heart of Oviedo on the Park. Savor our contemporary take on classic Southern dishes, made with locally sourced ingredients and a lot of love. It’s where good food and good times come together. LEARN MORE MEXICAN Tacos My Guey Since 2015, we started as a food truck in Orlando with one clear mission: to bring the essence of Mexican street tacos into a modern, vibrant space. Today, Tacos My Guey is more than a restaurant - it's a place where tradition and innovation meet in every bite. Our commitment is to deliver quality, hospitality, and an atmosphere that makes every moment worth celebrating. LEARN MORE ASIAN | VIETNAMESE | THAI Kai Asian Street Fare Experience the vibrant and bold flavors of Asia with Kai Asian Street Fare. Our menu is a curated selection of street food favorites from across the continent, made with fresh ingredients and authentic techniques. It’s a culinary adventure that’s sure to delight. LEARN MORE Waffle Press Waffle Co. Press Waffle Co. specializes in fully customizable authentic Belgian waffles, savory waffle creations, and locally roasted coffee. Perfect for breakfast, brunch, or dessert, any time is the right time to waffle! Come try the best waffle you've never had today! FAQ - The Food Factory Home About Us Plan Your Event FAQ Micro-Restaurants Oviedo Park Pub Buttercrust Pizza The Local Hen Tacos My Guey Kai Asian Street Fare Press Waffle Co. Grilled Cheezus Live Entertainment Join Our Team Contact Us Terms & Conditions Privacy Policy Host Your Event FAQ Home FAQ What is The Food Factory? The Food Factory is a collection of smaller (what we call micro-restaurants) encompassing approximately 14,500 square feet of well-designed indoor, covered outdoor, and open-air courtyard spaces for fabulous food, drink, games, and entertainment. It consists of seven 800 sf micro-restaurants run by local chefs. Each micro-restaurant has its own full kitchen and menu reflecting imaginative and high caliber fast-fine dining offerings unlike a food hall. Kid friendly. Outside courtyards are dog-friendly! What's the Story of the Food Factory? The Food Factory, nestled in the heart of Oviedo at the Oviedo on the Park, is a creative culinary initiative by Michael Collard Properties (MCP), a distinguished commercial real estate development firm with over 25 years of experience. This unique food hub is designed as an experiential gathering space, hosting eight chef-owned micro-restaurants and Oviedo Park Pub, your neighborhood bar, embodying MCP's vision of creating purposeful, interactive spaces that foster community engagement and offer an alternative to digital interaction. Through The Food Factory, MCP seeks to celebrate local culinary talent, encourage social connections, and contribute to the vibrant tapestry of Oviedo. For more details on MCP’s innovative projects and The Food Factory’s story, visit www.CollardProperties.com . Why are the restaurants called "micro-restaurants"? We call them “micro” because each is an 800 square foot restaurant with a full kitchen and its own seating, unlike a food hall with stalls, a commissary kitchen and warmed over food. Restrooms for the entire Collective are located next to Oviedo Park Pub to give the micro-restaurants added kitchen space. Why is there a rocket in the courtyard? The rocket in the courtyard serves as a vibrant tribute to our close connections with the University of Central Florida (UCF) and the iconic Space Coast. Located within a stone's throw of both, our establishment draws inspiration from the spirit of exploration and innovation that defines the area. These rockets symbolize our dedication to reaching new heights in culinary excellence and community gathering. Moreover, on select nights, our patio becomes the perfect spot for guests to witness the awe-inspiring rocket launches from Kennedy Space Center, making every visit to The Food Factory a potentially out-of-this-world experience. Have a question? Write us a message Send a message Δ About Us Discover Oviedo's culinary gem - where flavors meet and memories are made. Welcome to The Food Factory, your local hub for diverse dining and vibrant gatherings. The Latest News Oviedo Park Pub announces two-day Grand Opening Celebration Sept. 6 and 7 Alastair Mac Aug 26, 2024 2 min read Oviedo Park Pub offers craft cocktails, non-alcoholic drinks, craft beer and wine. Oviedo Park Pub serves as an event space and a place for customers of any micro-restaurant to gather and enjoy their meals. Pop the cork and raise a glass — Oviedo Park Pub is celebrating its grand opening with a two-day extravaganza on Friday, Sept. 6 and Saturday, Sept. 7, 2024. Oviedo Park Pub is under entirely new ownership, and the former Factory Bar space received an overhaul to become more inviting and vibey, with Oviedo Park Pub encouraging guests to meet, mingle and stay awhile. The latest bar, club and nightlife news from Orlando and throughout Central Florida. On Friday, Sept. 6 Oviedo Park Pub will officially open at 4 pm, kicking off two days of grand opening festivities including the following specials: One hour of free Michelob Ultra Drafts, select specialty cocktails and house wine from 5 - 6 pm., complimentary light bites, live entertainment, happy hour, and late-night happy hour specials all weekend long. Discover more of the latest events and things to do in Orlando with Gotta Go Orlando! Oviedo Park Pub is now owned by Brianna Feldman, owner of Buttercrust Pizza. A hospitality industry veteran, Feldman revitalized the event-friendly space to create a welcoming atmosphere with a full liquor bar for bourbon sippers, whiskey lovers, sports viewers and those who enjoy a friendly neighborhood pub. Enhancements to the newly renovated space include 15 new TVs and a 140-inch projector to watch the NFL Ticket, cushy tufted leather seating throughout and a central racetrack bar, perfect for enjoying a glass of wine or a cold beer. The specialty beverage menu features a rotating offering of unique whiskeys, bourbons, craft beer selections and hand-crafted seasonally changing drinks. As guests sip and socialize, they have the ability to order food from any of the six restaurants at The Food Factory and enjoy it within Oviedo Park Pub. For more information: https://ffoviedo.com/oviedoparkpub/ . We encourage you to be part of the local conversation, comment on this latest news below, and feel free to share this article on your social media channels. Club | Real Oviedo | Web Oficial Skip to main content Club Real Oviedo was founded in the capital of the Principality of Asturias on March 26th, 1926 by the union of Real Stadium Club Ovetense and Real Club Deportivo de Oviedo. The new organization appeared in society with a friendly match in Oviedo against Arenas de Guecho May 1st, 1926. Real Oviedo soon became one of the top teams in Spanish soccer. At the end of the 1932-33 season, they became the first club of the Principality of Asturias to get promoted to First Division. They achieved this recognition at home, at the Buenavista stadium, that had been inaugurated with a match between Spain and Yugoslavia April 24th,1932. Their debut in First Division was extraordinary, since they prevailed Barcelona by 7 goals to 3, which today is still recognized as the best start in the highest category of a team promoted from Second Division in the history of Spanish soccer. Real Oviedo was a candidate for the league title on some occasions, with the famous "electric forwards" that were some of the highest scoring in the country. The Spanish civil war truncated their possibilities when they were one of the main favorites to be champions in the 1936-37 season, which was not disputed by the war. Real Oviedo achieved several top category classifications in the history of Spanish football. They qualified in third place, three times in three different seasons, the last one in the 1962/1963 season. Real Oviedo managed in the 1991/1992 season to qualify to compete for their first time in a European competition: UEFA Cup. Throughout decades players like Oscar, Zabala, Lángara, Herrerita, Emilín, Sánchez Lage, Tensi, Galán, Marianín, Carlos, Jokanovic, Duvobský have worn the Real Oviedo blue jerseys .... Football players of international prestige have made the name of Real Oviedo more visable. Real Oviedo plays their home matches at the Carlos Tartiere Stadium. Its auxiliary facilities of El Requexón, patrimony of the own club, are located in the outskirts of the city. The first team and its subsidiary team carry out training there, while the 14 teams with more than 280 children in the youth academy teams carry out their activities in the Tensi facilities. These facilities are located in the sports complex La Pixarra in Oviedo. The number of Real Oviedo season ticket holders reached its peak in the 2015-2016 season with about 21,000. The average of the last decade, in which the team stayed away of the professional soccer, exceeded the 12,000 season ticket holders. Real Oviedo also boasts more than a hundred official supporters clubs spread over three continents and around 50,000 shareholders from more than 125 countries after the club's last capital increase in 2015. By Jenna Greaves ● Events , Oviedo , Seminole County , Winter Springs ● September 4, 2024 The Food Factory Oviedo hosts a grand opening for the Oviedo Park Pub, plus lots of sports and entertainment options locally this weekend. Thursday Watch Oviedo High School’s boys varsity golf team compete against Lake Brantley High School at 3:30 p.m. on Thursday, Sept. 5 at Twin Rivers Golf Club, 2100 Ekana Drive in Oviedo. Learn more . Watch Hagerty High School’s boys varsity golf team compete against Lake Mary High School at 3:30 p.m. on Thursday, Sept. 5 at Twin Rivers Golf Club, 2100 Ekana Drive in Oviedo. Learn more . Get free local news sent to your inbox every Thursday morning. Sign me up! Subscribe to our newsletter! Focus on fitness by going on a run through Oviedo with My Soxy Feet at 6 p.m. Thursday, Sept. 5 at Irish 31 Pub House and Eatery Oviedo, 65 W. Mitchell Hammock Road in Oviedo. Learn more . Friday Celebrate the grand opening weekend of Food Factory’s newest restaurant, Oviedo Park Pub, from 3-11 p.m. Friday, Sept. 6 at 888 City Walk Lane in Oviedo. Listen to Sunglasses at Night perform live from 7-11 p.m. at the event. The festivities will continue from 5-11 p.m. Saturday, Sept. 7. Learn more . Enjoy a night of live music by Thomas Watkins from 7-10 p.m. Friday, Sept. 6 at Spill Wine Bar, 1196 Tree Swallow Drive, Suite 1314, in Winter Springs. Learn more . Cheer on Oviedo High School’s boys varsity football team as they go head-to-head with Lake Brantley High School from 7-10 p.m. Friday Sept. 6 at Oviedo High School’s John Courier Field, 601 King St.. Learn more . Dance the night away with a live DJ and discount drinks at a late-night happy hour from 7-11 p.m. Friday, Sept. 6 at Pepe’s Cantina Mexican Grill, 3100 Alafaya Trail in Oviedo. Learn more . Saturday The Oviedo Farmers Market is this Saturday. (Photo by the Oviedo Photo Club) Shop until you drop for fresh produce from 8 a.m. to 1 p.m. Saturday, Sept. 7 at the Oviedo Farmers Market, 200 W. Broadway St. Learn more . Make your own butterfly garden from 10-11 a.m. Saturday, Sept. 7 at Lukas Nursery, 1909 Slavia Road in Oviedo. Tickets are $40 for participants and $10 for non-participants. Learn more . Practice self defense with a three–part series on Hanshi Kelley’s knife form that will cover the detailed movements of martial arts from 10 a.m. to 1 p.m. Saturday, Sept. 7 at North Wind Martial Arts Academy, 1753 W. Broadway St. in Oviedo. The series costs $40 for each part. Learn more . Create your own mini clay pig from 11 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. Saturday, Sept. 7 at Songbirds Music, Art, & Dance Center, 181 E. Mitchell Hammock Road in Oviedo. Tickets are $20 to craft. Learn more . Make a splash at the Lake Monroe Sailing Association pirate-themed pool party from 1-8 p.m. at Live Oak Pool and Clubhouse, 1901 Live Oak Reserve Blvd. in Oviedo. Learn more . Cheer on the University of Central Florida’s football team as they face the Sam Houston State Bearkats for Family Weekend at 6:30 p.m., Saturday, Sept. 7 at the FBC Mortgage Stadium, 4465 Knights Victory Way in Orlando. Learn more . Listen to live music by Clint and Laila from 7-10 p.m. Saturday, Sept. 7 at Spill Wine Bar, 1196 Tree Swallow Drive, Suite 1314, in Winter Springs. Learn more . Sunday Challenge friends and family to a board game night from 12:30-7 p.m. Sunday, Sept. 8 at Oviedo Brewing Company, 1280 Oviedo Mall Blvd., Suite 1095. Tickets cost $5. Learn more . Learn the mental healing power of acupuncture from 4-5:30 p.m. Sunday, Sept. 8 at Sacred Moments Massage & Healing Center, 995 Westwood Square in Oviedo. It costs $35 to attend. Learn more . Enjoy breakfast and learn about Temple Israel Sisterhood at 10 a.m. Sunday, Sept. 8 at Temple Israel Orlando, 50 S. Moss Road in Winter Springs. Learn more . Future Events Pay tribute to those affected by 9/11 with a remembrance ceremony from 8:30-9 a.m. Wednesday, Sept. 11 at the Winter Springs Police Department, 300 N. Moss Road in Winter Springs. Learn more . Honor the lives lost in the 9/11 tragedy with a commemoration ceremony and flag retirement from 12-12:30 p.m. Wednesday, Sept. 11 at American Legion Oviedo Memorial Post 243, 491 W. Broadway. Learn more . Sip on something sweet at Tuscany Wines’ wine tasting from 7-9 p.m. Thursday, Sept. 12 at Spill Wine Bar, 1196 Tree Swallow Drive, Suite 1314, in Winter Springs. The event is free for club members and $15 for non-members. Learn more . Enjoy a symphony of sounds at the opening night of St. Luke’s Concert Series from 7-9 p.m. Friday, Sept. 13 and 2-4 p.m. Saturday, Sept. 14 at St. Luke’s Lutheran Church, 2021 W. State Road 426 in Oviedo. Learn more. Grow your knowledge about tomatoes at the All About Tomatoes Seminar from 10-11 a.m. at Lukas Nursery, 1909 Slavia Road in Oviedo. Tickets cost $10 for attendees. Learn more . Play trivia with the Oviedo Community News team and celebrate three years of public service journalism in the community from 6-9 p.m. Tuesday, Sept. 17 at Spill Wine Bar, 1196 Tree Swallow Drive, Suite 1314, in Winter Springs. Space is limited. Learn more . Enjoy a three-day celebration of Oktoberfest from 5-9 p.m. Thursday, Sept. 26; 4-9 p.m. Saturday, Sept. 27; and 5-9 p.m. Saturday, Sept. 28 at Center Lake Park, 299 Center Lake Lane in Oviedo. The event is free to attend, with beer punch cards available for $25. Learn more . Regular Events Dementia-Friendly Dining is every Tuesday from 2-5 p.m. at Perkins Restaurant, 701 E. State Road 434 in Winter Springs; every Wednesday from 2-5 p.m. at the Town House Restaurant, 139 N. Central Ave. in Oviedo; and every Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday from 2-4 p.m. at Pepe’s Cantina, 3100 Alafaya Trail in Oviedo. Families and friends may bring their loved ones who are living with dementia to a friendly, safe, and enjoyable meal. Learn more . Mondays Enjoy “Mingle Mondays” with varied activities every Monday from 10 a.m.-noon at Palm Medical Centers, 220 Alafaya Woods Blvd. in Oviedo. Anyone aged 65 and older can participate in a different activity every week, such as rock painting, charades, bingo, trivia and more. Learn more. Take part in four rounds of live pub-style trivia with the Five Minute Professor from 7-9 p.m. every Monday at Rock & Brews, 7131 Red Bug Lake Road in Oviedo. Questions cover topics such as history, geography, pop music, TV shows, science, nature, movie stars and space travel. Prizes are given every week, and a raffle takes place on the last Monday of every month. Enjoy happy hour before and after trivia. Learn more . Take part in twice-a-week yoga sessions at 9 a.m. every Monday and 3 p.m. every Thursday at Oviedo Woman’s Club, 414 King St. Learn more . Tuesdays Take a yoga class every Tuesday morning at 10 a.m. with Don Cross at the Rural Heritage Center, 101 E. Main St. in Geneva. The class meets in the Lake Jessup Room. Text Don at 407-415-3809 for more information. Take a run through Oviedo’s historic downtown every Tuesday night with Oviedo Run Club. Most folks who attend this casual social run start the run just before 6 p.m. Participants start in the parking lot of the Historic Celery Precooler, located at 159 N. Central Ave. and run the distance of their choice along the Cross Seminole Trail. New members get a free T-shirt. Learn more . Join Oviedo Brewing Run Club’s Tuesday Night Run from 6:30-10 p.m. at 1280 Oviedo Mall Blvd. Participants gather at the front of Oviedo Brewing Company every Tuesday evening and start the run at 6:30 p.m. Adventure Cycling offers two night bicycle rides a week. Enjoy a No Rider Left Behind ride for the whole family from 6:30-9:30 p.m. on Tuesday nights. Learn more . Practice calming yin meditation on Tuesdays from 6-7:15 p.m. at Our Suite Village, 1750 W. Broadway St., Suite 112, in Oviedo. The first class is $5 and regular classes are $15. Text Cathy at 786-520-6736 to reserve a spot and learn more. Wednesdays Join The Geneva Village Homemakers at 10 a.m. the second Wednesday of every month at the Geneva Community Center, 161 First St. in Geneva. The all-age group has a book club, a cards and games club, and a dinner club. Learn more, call 407-349-0040. Make unique greeting cards during card classes from 2-4 p.m. or 6-8 p.m. every Wednesday at BeauQCreations, 1327 W. Broadway St. in Oviedo. Learn more . Sing your heart out at Open Mic Nite every Wednesday from 6-9 p.m. at Spill Wine Bar, 1196 Tree Swallow Drive in Winter Springs. Enjoy drink specials, food options and live music. Learn more . Enjoy live traditional Irish music sessions every Wednesday from 6-9 p.m. at Irish 31 Oviedo, 65 W. Mitchell Hammock Road. Learn more . Experience community acupuncture on Wednesdays from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. at Zen Space Wellness, 1945 W. County Road 419, Suite 1111, in Oviedo. Prices range from $25-50. Pay what you can afford for 30-60 minutes. Call Melanie at 407-488-8830 to schedule an appointment and learn more. Test your skills at a weekly chess meetup with Seminole County Chess from 6-9 p.m. every Wednesday at the Oviedo Mall Food Court, 1700 Oviedo Mall Blvd. Learn more. Pub-style trivia with the Five Minute Professor takes place from 7-9 p.m. every Wednesday at Gator’s Dockside, 167 E. Mitchell Hammock Road in Oviedo. Prizes are given every week, and a raffle takes place the last Wednesday of every month. Enjoy an all-you-can-eat boneless wings special on Wednesday. Learn more . Thursdays Get an intense workout at Adventure Cycling’s Throwdown ride from 6:30-9:30 p.m. every Thursday. Learn more . It starts at 1491 E. State Road 434, Suite 110, in Winter Springs. Join local veterans every Thursday for a Burger Night event from 5-7 p.m. at the Winter Springs Veterans of Foreign Wars Post 5405, 420 N. Edgemon Ave. Learn more . The Irish 3.1 Run Club meets every Thursday at 6:30 p.m. at Irish 31, 65 W. Mitchell Hammock Road in Oviedo. Learn more . Attend Oviedo Jeep Club’s monthly meetup from 6-8 p.m. on the second Thursday of each month at varying locations. Mingle with other Jeep owners while enjoying food and drinks. Learn more . Play trivia from 7-9 p.m. every Thursday at Oviedo Oyster House, 1340 Alafaya Trail. Learn more . Race your radio controlled car at a Seven Tails Circuit event at 7 p.m. every Thursday at the Oviedo Mall, hosted by the Orlando Mini Z Club. The event invites folks to come “test, tune and race.” Learn more . Fridays Join the “Fabulous Fridays” tea party every Friday from 10 a.m. to noon at Palm Medical Centers, 220 Alafaya Woods Blvd. in Oviedo. Anyone aged 65 and older can play games while enjoying music, pastries and tea. Enjoy Free Bingo Night at District Eat and Play Oviedo every Friday night from 6-7 p.m. at 1395 Oviedo Mall Blvd. Learn more . Saturdays Attend karaoke night at Oviedo Oyster House at 9 p.m. every Saturday at 1340 Alafaya Trail. Learn more . Get ready to cycle with a Breakfast Ride every Saturday from 8-11 a.m. at Adventure Cycling, 1491 E. State Road 434, Suite 110 in Winter Springs. Ride either 8 or 20 miles and enjoy a potluck-style breakfast afterward at this free event. Learn more . Be a bookworm with storytime at B. Dalton Bookseller at 1 p.m. every Saturday and Sunday at Oviedo Mall, 1700 Oviedo Mall Blvd. Kids can enjoy snacks and activities while improving their literary skills. Learn more . Sundays Attend breakfast by the river every Sunday from 10 a.m. to noon at Barr Trail, 851 Barr St. in Oviedo. This is a family-and-dog-friendly event that offers fruit, tea and more. Learn more . Get up on stage and share your talent for open mic night from 8 p.m. to midnight every Sunday at Muldoon’s Saloon, 7439 Aloma Ave. in Winter Park. Learn more . Bring your differently abled child to Special Needs Open Gym from 2-3 p.m. monthly on Sundays at United Gymnastics Academy Oviedo, 542 S. Econ Circle. The cost is $5. Learn more . The Museum of Geneva History is open from 2-4 p.m.  every second and fourth Sunday at 165 First St. Admission is free, but donations are appreciated. See local archaeological finds, pioneer crafts, family records and Civil War information. Learn more by calling 407-349-5697. Sorry for the interruption but please take 1 minute to read this. The news depends on it. Did you know each article on Oviedo Community News takes anywhere from 10-15 hours to produce and edit and costs between $325 and $600? Your support makes it possible. We believe that access to local news is a right, not a privilege, which is why our journalism is free for everyone. But we rely on readers like you to keep this work going. Your contribution keeps us independent and dedicated to our community. If you believe in the value of local journalism, please make a tax-deductible contribution today or choose a monthly gift to help us plan for the future. Thank you for supporting Oviedo Community News! With gratitude, Megan Stokes, OCN editor-in-chief SUPPORT OVIEDO COMMUNITY NEWS Thank you for reading! Before you go... We are interested about hearing news in our community! Let us know what's happening! Reach out Share a story! Author Jenna Greaves Jenna is a senior print/digital journalism major with a political science/pre-law minor at the University of Central Florida. The journalist in her lives for exploring the world and learning as she goes. She loves getting to know people and absorbing knowledge. Over the years, she has written for multiple publications such as UCF’s student newspaper NSM Today , the Sanford Herald , Central Florida Lifestyle magazine and Z88.3 F.M. Grilled Cheezus Live Entertainment Join Our Team Contact Us Terms & Conditions Privacy Policy Host Your Event About Us Our Story and Vision Home About Us ABOUT US The Food Factory Story and Vision Crafting Culinary Experiences in the Heart of Oviedo Welcome to The Food Factory, not just a place to eat, but a community hub nestled in the vibrant Oviedo on the Park. Our story begins with a vision to create a unique dining destination that celebrates the diversity of flavors, cultures, and culinary talents. We're more than a collection of restaurants; we're a gathering place where families, friends, and food lovers can come together to share meals and create memories. Visit us at The Food Factory and experience the joy of shared meals and the warmth of community dining. Our Mission To offer an unparalleled dining experience by hosting a diverse array of micro-restaurants under one roof, each bringing its own unique flavor and flair to the table. We aim to support local chefs and entrepreneurs, providing a platform for them to showcase their culinary creations to the wider community. Our Community At The Food Factory, community comes first. We are committed to creating a welcoming, inclusive atmosphere where every guest feels at home. Our location in Oviedo on the Park underscores our dedication to being an integral part of the local fabric, contributing to the area's vibrancy and charm. Our Culinary Philosophy Quality, creativity, and diversity drive our culinary philosophy. From authentic Mexican cuisine and Asian street fare to Southern comfort food and artisanal pizzas, our micro-restaurants cater to a wide range of tastes and dietary preferences. We believe in using fresh, locally-sourced ingredients to craft dishes that delight the senses and nourish the soul. Looking Ahead As we look to the future, The Food Factory is excited to continue expanding our culinary offerings, hosting events, and strengthening our ties to the Oviedo community. We're not just building a food destination; we're fostering a space where culture, cuisine, and community meet. CELEBRATE WITH US Host Your Event with Us! Whether you’re planning an intimate gathering, a birthday bash, a corporate meeting, or a special celebration, our unique setting ensures an experience your guests will talk about for years to come.
